availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Marion Fish (Mount Vernon, Kentucky, farmer and court clerk)

body.p: Mount Vernon, Kentucky, farmer and court clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Telitha French Fish in 1856. Father of Mary Fish and Thomas Fish. Clerk of the Rockcastle County Court from 1864 to 1865.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Northern District, p. 190; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mt. Vernon, p. 88; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mt. Vernon, Voting District 1, p. 60; Kentucky Birth, Marriage, and Death Records, 1852-1910, Ancestry, Marriages, Rockcastle County, 1856; William T. Samuels, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865 (Frankfort, KY: George D. Prentice, 1866), p. 12; Find A Grave, "William Marion Fish (1828-1900)," Memorial #5863354, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=5863354 (accessed August 9, 2017).
